Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power, he says, the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the war, he allows that,`` In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped.'' But he insists that
